lines.content: # Sam the Zen Master User Guide
üßò‚Äç‚ôÇÔ∏è Welcome to Sam the Zen Master - your mindful task management companion. Sam helps you organize your tasks with wisdom, peace, and gentle guidance.
Launch the application and Sam will greet you with a peaceful welcome message. Type your commands in the text field and press Enter or click Send.
Sam responds: "üå± A new intention has taken root in your journey: [T] [ ] [MEDIUM] read a book"
Sam responds: "üå± A new intention has taken root in your journey: [D] [ ] [MEDIUM] submit assignment (by: 2024-12-01)"
Sam responds: "üå± A new intention has taken root in your journey: [E] [ ] [MEDIUM] team meeting (from: 2pm to: 4pm)"
Sam will bid you a peaceful farewell.
May your productivity journey be mindful and balanced! üå∏
* Represents the different commands that can be executed by the Sam
* This enum defines all the valid command types and provides a method to parse
* string input into the corresponding command.
BYE, LIST, MARK, UNMARK, DELETE, TODO, DEADLINE, EVENT, FIND, PRIORITY, UNKNOWN;

* @param verb The string representation of the command
* @return The corresponding Command enum value, or UNKNOWN if no match is found

* Represents the main application class for Sam, a task management application.

// Essential constants for configuration and error messages

private static final String EVENT_FORMAT_ERROR = "üå∏ Events flow from start to end. Use: event <description> /from <start> /to <end>";
private static final String FIND_KEYWORD_ERROR = "üîç To seek, one must name what they search for. Please provide a keyword.";
private static final String TASK_NUMBER_ERROR = "üßÆ Numbers bring order to chaos. Please provide a valid task number.";

return "üßò‚Äç‚ôÇÔ∏è Greetings, I am Sam the Zen Master.\nIn stillness, all tasks find their place. How may I guide your productivity journey today?";

case BYE -> "üôè May peace accompany you on your journey. Until we meet again in mindful productivity!";

* Handles the priority command to change task priority.
* @param rest The task number and priority level
* @return The response message after changing priority

private String handlePriorityCommand(String rest) throws SamException {
throw new SamException("‚öñÔ∏è Priority requires both task and level. Use: priority <task_number> <priority_level>");

return "‚öñÔ∏è Balance restored. The priority flows like water finding its level:\n" + task;
* Helper method to save tasks to storage.

private static int parseIndex(final String arg, final int size) throws SamException {
assert arg != null && !arg.trim().isEmpty() : "Argument cannot be null or empty";
throw new SamException("OOPS!!! Invalid task number.");

* Handles the storage and retrieval of tasks from a file.
* This class provides methods to load tasks from a file and save tasks to a file,
* supporting persistence of the task list between application sessions.
* Constructs a Storage object with the specified file path.
* @param filePath The path to the file where tasks will be stored
assert filePath != null && !filePath.trim().isEmpty() : "File path cannot be null or empty";
* Loads tasks from the storage file.

assert tasks != null : "Task list cannot be null";
assert task != null : "Individual tasks cannot be null";

assert parts.length >= TASK_EXTRA_INFO_INDEX + 1 : "Deadline must have due date";
Deadline deadline = new Deadline(description, isDone, extraInfo);
// For Event, expect: E | 1 | HIGH | description | from | to

Event event = new Event(description, isDone, extraInfo, secondExtraInfo);
assert task != null : "Task cannot be null";

* Handles the parsing of user input commands.
* This class provides functionality to split user input into command verbs and
* making it easier for the application to process different types of commands.
* Parses user input by splitting it into a command verb and arguments.
* The input is split at the first whitespace, with the first part becoming the
* and the remaining part becoming the arguments.
* @param input The raw user input string to be parsed
* @return A String array where index 0 contains the command verb and index 1
public static String[] parse(final String input) {

* Each input is processed individually using the standard parse method.
* @param inputs Variable number of input strings to be parsed
* @return A 2D String array where each row contains [verb, arguments] for each input
public static String[][] parseMultiple(final String... inputs) {
* Represents a deadline task in the task management system.
* A deadline task has a description, completion status, and a due date/time.
* It extends the base Task class and provides deadline-specific functionality.
* Constructs a new Deadline task with the given description and due date.
* The task is initially marked as not done.
* @param description The description of the deadline task
* @param by The due date/time for the task
public Deadline(final String description, final String by) {
* Constructs a new Deadline task with the given description, completion status, and due date.
* @param description The description of the deadline task
* @param isDone The initial completion status of the task
* @param by The due date/time for the task
public Deadline(final String description, final boolean isDone, final String by) {
* Returns the type indicator for Deadline tasks.
* @return The string "[D]" representing a Deadline task
* Returns a string representation of the deadline task.
* @return A string containing the task type, status, priority, description, and due date
return kind() + status() + " [" + getPriority().getDisplayName() + "] " + description + " (by: " + by + ")";
* Returns the raw due date/time string for storage purposes.
* @return The due date/time string as stored internally
* Represents an event task in the task management system.
* An event task has a description, completion status, start time, and end time.
* It extends the base Task class and provides event-specific functionality.
* Constructs a new Event task with the given description, start time, and end time.
* The task is initially marked as not done.
* @param description The description of the event task
* @param from The start time of the event
* @param to The end time of the event
public Event(final String description, final String from, final String to) {
* Constructs a new Event task with the given description, completion status, start time, and end time.
* @param description The description of the event task
* @param isDone The initial completion status of the task
* @param from The start time of the event
* @param to The end time of the event
public Event(final String description, final boolean isDone, final String from, final String to) {
* Returns the type indicator for Event tasks.
* @return The string "[E]" representing an Event task
* Returns a string representation of the event task.
* @return A string containing the task type, status, priority, description, start time, and end time
return kind() + status() + " [" + getPriority().getDisplayName() + "] " + description + " (from: " + from + " to: " + to + ")";
* Returns the raw start time string for storage purposes.
* @return The start time string as stored internally
* Returns the raw end time string for storage purposes.

* Represents the priority levels for tasks.
* Tasks can have different priority levels to help users organize their work.
* @param displayName The display name for the priority
* Gets the display name of the priority.
* Parses a priority from a string input.
* @throws IllegalArgumentException If the input is invalid
* Returns the string representation of the priority.
* @return The display name of the priority
* Represents a task in the task management system.
* This is the base class for all types of tasks (Todo, Deadline, Event).
* Each task has a description, priority level, and can be marked as done or not done.
* Constructs a new Task with the given description.
* The task is initially marked as not done and has medium priority.
* @param description The description of the task
assert description != null && !description.trim().isEmpty() : "Task description cannot be null or empty";
* Constructs a new Task with the given description and priority.
* The task is initially marked as not done.
* @param description The description of the task
* @param priority The priority level of the task
public Task(final String description, final Priority priority) {
assert description != null && !description.trim().isEmpty() : "Task description cannot be null or empty";
assert priority != null : "Priority cannot be null";

* Sets the priority of the task.
assert priority != null : "Priority cannot be null";

* Returns the description of the task.

* @return A string representing the task type (empty string for base Task
* Returns a string representation of the task's completion status.

* Returns a string representation of the task.
* @return A string containing the task type, status, priority, and description
* Manages a collection of tasks in the task management system.
* This class provides operations to add, remove, retrieve, and manage tasks
* in a list structure, serving as the main container for all user tasks.
* Constructs an empty TaskList with no initial tasks.

assert tasks != null : "Task list cannot be null";
* Returns the underlying ArrayList of tasks.

assert task != null : "Task cannot be null";
* Adds multiple tasks to the task list using varargs.
* @param tasksToAdd Variable number of tasks to be added to the list
* Removes a task at the specified index from the task list.
* @param index The index of the task to be removed
assert index >= 0 && index < tasks.size() : "Index must be valid (0 <= index < size)";
* Retrieves a task at the specified index from the task list.
* @param index The index of the task to be retrieved
* @return The task at the specified index
assert index >= 0 && index < tasks.size() : "Index must be valid (0 <= index < size)";
* Returns the total number of tasks in the list.
* @return The size of the task list

* A todo task is a basic task with just a description and completion status.
* It extends the base Task class and provides a specific type indicator.

* The task is initially marked as not done.

* Constructs a new Todo task with the given description and completion status.

* @param isDone      The initial completion status of the task
public Todo(final String description, final boolean isDone) {

* Returns the completion status of the task.
* @return true if the task is done, false otherwise
* Returns a formatted string representation of the task for storage.
* @return A string in the format "T | 1 | description" or "T | 0 | description"
System.out.println(" What can I do for you?");
